eventName: Come Catastrophes or Wakes of Vultures
storyInfo: In the middle of the merriment, Leone's son suddenly announces that he is leaving Davistown. The atmosphere instantly chills over, and everyone leaves unhappy.

attributes.content: ♪She spread her arms, spread her heart, showed me that pretty face♪
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: ♪And from that moment on, I found my dreams in her embrace♪
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: I still remember when you fellas got together to sing that, back in the day. Your voices lit up the entire room... Felt like your singing cleared up the winter fog that year.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Always the same song as just now, ma'am?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Haha, hardly. They knew all sorts of songs. The miners came from all over, bringing so many songs in so many languages.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Umm... Does Woodrow also know how to sing?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: He ain't much of a talker. Whenever we all get together, he just stuffs his face. Like now.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: *cough* *cough*... Helena, when are you gonna crack open the bottle of champagne I brought back?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Shoot, I really am getting old, huh? Nearly forgot.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Umm, about Miles... He...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Don't worry about him. Said he wanted to take a stroll, so he did.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Just pop the cork and pour him a glass. We can toast when he comes back!
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Alright, without further ado—
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: The cork shoots out with a pop, golden wine and silver foam splashing out at the same time. The sweet aroma spreads across the room, and wondrous befuddlement sparkles in the eyes of everyone at the table.
Here, Jessica, you're the star tonight, so the first glass is for you.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Thank you...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Next up is you, Woody. Thanks for helping her talk some sense into that stubborn old burdenbeast.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Don't mention it.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: This one's for Miles... This one's for me... And last and definitely least is you, Leone. For killing us with worry all this time.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Okay, I deserved that.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: To be perfectly honest, I actually—
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: If you got something to say, better wait for Miles. You ain't gonna leave him out like that, are you?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Ah, yeah, makes sense.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: The table that had been lively all evening falls quiet, and the spilled champagne seeps silently into dark, unseen places.
Past bowls and plates.
Excuse me...
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: What is it, Benny?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Past cups and saucers.
Actually... there's something I wanted to announce to everyone...
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Was wondering why you were so quiet today, but I guess you had something brewing. Waiting to snatch the spotlight from your dad at the dinner table?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Benny, why don't you wait for Miles too?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Past empty wine bottles.
No... I think now's the best time.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Until it flows over the table's edge, and seeps into the floor.
Snap.
I'm leaving.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Hah, guess you finally got sick of us noisy old farts. Can't you wait for Miles to get back, so we can share one last drink before we say goodbye?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: No... I meant I'm leaving Davistown.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Look at this kid, getting drunk without touching a drop of champagne.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: No, I'm perfectly sober.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: It's something I've been meaning to get off my chest... But I never got the chance, so I'm saying it now.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: What's wrong? Why's everyone look like it just started raining?
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: Miles, I...
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Benny just said... that he wants to leave Davistown.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Wh-What?
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: How long you been thinking about this, boy?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: About a year or so...
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Last month, Ms. Selena from next door came over and said that her daughter in Ironforge City managed to find a caravan willing to come through here. She said she was planning to go with it to follow her daughter.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: She asked if I wanted to come. She thought it'd be a waste of my talents to stay. No matter how much I learn here, I wouldn't have a place to use any of it.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: She told me... she didn't want me to become the next Sylvia.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: What about your living expenses? Tuition? Where are you gonna live?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Don't worry, there are plenty of boarding schools in Ironforge City willing to provide scholarships so I can study there.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Benny... why wait so long to discuss this with us? It's a big decision... You know better than that.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: ...I'm sorry, Miles.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: He ain't asking for our input.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Just letting us know the decision he's made.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: ...Have you thought this through? Weighed the pros and cons? Who knows, this place might perk up once it gets moving again. You can always decide then.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: I don't want to wait that long.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: The only reason you're all willing to stay put and pray things get better is because you remember the good old days.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: But I don't. This place has been a dump for as long as I can remember.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: ...My adoptive father worked so hard for this place, throwing away everything else without hesitation. My brother took his place as a pillar of the family, and wanted to join a mercenary group when he came of age. To earn money to send back home.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: But a few years later... Those people sent his belongings back, with no explanation in the attached letter except a few lines saying they're sorry.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: There should've been another path for him back then. Just like... there should be one for me now.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: ....Am I wrong?
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: So when are you leaving?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: ...Tomorrow. I know I shouldn't have waited this long to tell you, but if I don't say it now... I'll never get another chance.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: The boy glances across the table at his father, mustering the courage to look him in the eyes. He desperately hopes to see anger and resentment.
That would make him feel a little less guilty, a little less conflicted.
But his father simply hangs his head and remains silent, completely at a loss for words.
Leone...
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: It's fine... It'll be alright...
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: It's not a bad idea...
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: You should leave... You deserve it...
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Helena gives Leone a few pats on the shoulder, but he simply continues to mechanically repeat a few words of approval, prompting her to shake him a bit harder.
It's fine, Helena. I'll be alright... This is how it should be...
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Then, I wish you a safe journey. Take care of yourself, kid.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Why's it so damn cold here?
I picked up some wood we can burn. Feel any better yet?
Judging from how you curled up into a ball, I'm guessing you've never been through anything like this? *sigh*... How could your folks think you'd make it as a mercenary?
Huh? You decided on it yourself? But why? Did you get in a fight with your family?
Oh... There are people you want to protect, and problems you want to solve, huh? Mm, sounds pretty ambitious, if you ask me. I'm a bit jealous, to be honest.
Most people you see out here in these ruins, on the battlefield, were pushed here by circumstance. Myself included.
Driven by poverty. By injustice. By darkness and violence. We often pick up our weapons and rashly open fire, without worrying about what we're aiming at.
Right up until we finally step in a puddle of mud and look down at our footprints, only to realize that what we just stepped in... was a river of blood.
When that happens, I'm sure there's some noble ideal that can keep you from collapsing in defeat. Too bad I never found out what it was... I was only in it for the money.
My family owes a lot of money. And my little brother, well, he's damn smart. If he'd been born rich, he'd be at the top of his class.
But if he stays back home... the only future he's got is as a debt collector.
I... I don't think that counts as being in it only for the money. You're doing it for your family... That's noble too.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Eh, who can say? But for now at least...
We're doing it just to survive.
The attack's about to begin...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Stop drinking already, Leone.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: ...Can I sleep at the diner tonight?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: If you want.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: (*whispers*) Poor fella... Just look at him... *sigh*...
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: (*whispers*) It's just like seven years ago...
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: What, you guys gonna talk about Carl now? Don't mind me. No need to tiptoe around it.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: This is already the second time... The second time...
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Twice now... So why're you avoiding me? You think... you think I can't handle it?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Thank you for bringing me here, Jessica. You can head back now.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: I... still don't feel very good about this.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I don't think your boss would be happy with how you're always fretting over us.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: I just... can't bear to stand on the sidelines when there's something I can do.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Still, you helped Dad keep the house, so thanks again.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: But the reason he finally sold his shares... was because of you.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I know. He had to give up what was most precious to him just to keep a roof over my head. But with me gone, he'll finally be free to do what he really wants.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: In that sense, the house was never the obstacle. It was me and my brother.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: ...Do you remember my brother?
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: You're talking about Carl? I've heard you and Helena mention him before.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Yeah, we know him as Carl... But over at Blacksteel, he went by a codename—Blackplate.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: ...Blackplate?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: It's water under the bridge, Leone. Why dredge it up now...
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: No point trying to stop him, Miles. Just let him talk. He never brought it up, so we didn't say nothing. But now that he wants to look back, it's our job to let him.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: ...I suppose.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: I didn't ask for these thoughts... But in the dead of night, do I really have any control over what pops into my head?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: The more I dwelled on it, the more painful it was. The more painful it was, the less it made sense... But, Benny figured that all out a long time ago.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: He was right. Every step Carl took was never really his own choice. Because I was too stubborn, too arrogant. I ended up running everything dry... our money, our lives, and our choices.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: When I was little, there was a miner who'd always complain how nothing was easy anymore when you're middle-aged. You run outta energy and can only focus on a few things at a time.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: So you gotta be smart, gotta keep your eyes on what really matters. Stop being greedy.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: But when it was my turn to grow old, I just refused to accept it. I grabbed the wrong end of the rope, and held on for dear life. Told myself I was a brave warrior, fighting the good fight against fate itself...
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: And what do I have to show for it?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Fought my way into a mountain of debt. Fought for a Davistown on its last legs. Fought for my eldest to die on the battlefield. My second son saw right through me, so why wouldn't he run the hell away?!
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Leone, we all know how much the mine means to you...
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: Then tell me, how much?! Because I haven't a damn clue at this point!
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: All I know is that I should've held onto those little hands back then. The hands of my children...
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: I was a damn fool. How could I not see the writing on the walls when I heard that complaint?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: I should've etched those words into my mind...
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: My dad might be an old fool with the memory of a sieve, but I'm not.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: I recognized you the moment I saw you. The emblem on your uniform and your gear. It's the exact same one I saw on the bag with Carl's personal affects.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: He... He was your brother... I never realized...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Did he never tell you his real name? Or did you simply forget all about him?
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: I remember him... I didn't work with him for very long, but how could I forget?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: You actually worked with Carl?
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: In Chernobog. We were left together to scout out the strength of the enemies hidden in the ruins... I was there when he was injured. I-I was so flustered at the time, my mind went completely blank. I-I...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: You were there when he died.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Y-Yes... I was.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: But you still didn't know his real name.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Actually...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.text: Actually, the time I spent with him was very short.
Actually, I was so scared back then that I barely remember a thing.
Actually, mercenaries always keep a few secrets close to their hearts, that they don't readily disclose to others.
Actually... there is no 'actually' at all. Jessica knows this very well.

attributes.content: ...I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: It's alright. That wasn't the point I was trying to make.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: What I wanted to know is, have you ever seen a silver ring inlaid with diamonds?
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: It belonged to his biological mother, and he always carried it with him. But it wasn't in the bag sent back by your company.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: If you watched him die... then surely you know what happened to it. Were you the one who took it? If so, give me back my brother's things.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: No... I-I have no idea. I've never seen him with a ring like that... Maybe it got lost.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: ...How could Carl possibly lose that ring?
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Finally done with the last one... Let's take a look. Oho, number 120.
attributes.name: Bored Bank Employee

attributes.content: With just a few strokes of the pen, a hundred and twenty people have been sent to the frontier.
attributes.name: Indifferent Bank Employee

attributes.content: Well, you better keep that pen moving or you'll be next.
attributes.name: Bored Bank Employee

attributes.content: Sylvia, mind getting the lights? I'm going to go lie down for a sec.
attributes.name: Indifferent Bank Employee

attributes.content: A hundred and twenty people...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Sylvia's stress and anxiety make her habitually reach up to fumble around her collar. As soon as she feels the familiar ring resting atop her chest, she hastily gives it a squeeze.
The ring's unyielding texture digs into her palm, yet gradually calms her down as well.
Just like that embrace seven years ago. It was so tight she couldn't breathe, yet it eventually placated her surging tears.
Carl... What should I do?
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: What else... is there for me to do...?
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Since you don't know where it is... Head back, Jessica. Thanks for sending me off.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Honestly, I'm grateful that you convinced Dad to choose the house. Now, even if I decide to leave... he won't be left with nothing.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: At the end of the day, those shares did nothing but make him feel a bit better. Not a damn thing.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: If... If he ultimately wasn't able to keep the house, w-would you still have chosen to leave?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: ...I don't know. I don't want to be an obstinate fool, but... I don't want to be an ingrate either.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Alright, this is goodbye for real, Jessica.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Why are you still following me? What do you hope to accomplish? What can you even do at this point?
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: I-I'm not sure myself... All I know is... I don't think you should leave like this.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Please, go back already. I'm begging you.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: You're holding a golden nail in your hand. It's extremely valuable, but... please don't use it to repair paper houses.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: In the end, no matter how hard you work at it, all you'll be left with are a few extra holes.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Paper that thin will crumble under its weight anyway.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Go back to where you belong, the house swathed in silver and gold. Find a place where you can drive that nail in. That's where it truly belongs.
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: So please, just stop following me. Alright?
attributes.name: Benny

attributes.content: Has Benny gone back yet?
Yes, Woodrow. I saw him home.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Then why ain't you heading back, too?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I won't be able to fall asleep even if I do. I wanted a little bit of time to myself.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: What the hell did that brat say to you?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Just something... very reasonable. It reminded me of...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: It reminded me of a few things. A few things I should've already known.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: ...Ever since I was little, helping others was like grabbing a little yellow toy fowlbeast in a crystal-clear bathtub. All I had to do was extend my hand, and I'd be able to prevent the tub from spilling over.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: But that's because the faucet built with the wealth and authority bestowed to me only dispensed the warmest, clearest water. That's why everything around me always looked so pristine.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: But as soon as I stepped out from that bathtub, from my family circle, I came face-to-face with... reality.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: ...Reality is a murky quagmire. When you reach in, you have no idea what you'll pull out. Or what you'll touch.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: There's no reason for you to agonize over this.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: To be blunt, nothing you did meant a damn thing to Benny's final decision.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I watched that kid grow up. He's been full of good ideas since he was little. Great ideas. He...
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: He really takes after someone I once knew. When he sorts things out in his head and makes up his mind, he'll set off in a straight line and never look back. He'll clear a path forward, but no way back.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Sounds like... an extremely determined person. Almost irrationally so.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Hardly. He was the most rational person I know: the source of all our problems, as well as the solutions, can only be found on the road ahead of us.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I... I'm a bit jealous of people like that. Being that perceptive at a young age must save you a lot of unnecessary detours.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Don't ever envy people for that, Jessica.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: ...Why do you say that?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Because they'll end up bald. Not a single strand of hair.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: ...Thanks for the reassurance.
attributes.name: Jessica
